pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 215, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 320, 390, 337]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 367, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 327, 399]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 447, 284, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 462, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 494, 590, 509]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 540, 606, 555]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 572, 440, 587]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 384, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|4 - 5x| < 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 133, 96, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 123, 918, 163]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\int_{2}^{6} \frac{2}{4x + 1} \mathrm{~d}x = \ln \frac{5}{3}.\) [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 192, 94, 210]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[339, 201, 695, 440]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 459, 920, 497]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the part of the curve \(y = \frac{1}{2}\tan 2x\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\). Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the points on this part of the curve at which the gradient is 4.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 478, 920, 497]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 524, 92, 544]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 523, 848, 544]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(3^{2x} - 7(3^x) + 10 = 0\), giving your answers correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 523, 920, 542]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 572, 92, 590]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 570, 920, 606]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(4x^{3} + ax^{2} + 9x + 9\), where \(a\) is a constant, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((2x - 1)\) the remainder is 10.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 618, 153, 636]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 617, 690, 636]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\) and hence verify that \((x - 3)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 617, 920, 636]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 648, 153, 666]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 648, 566, 666]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) has this value, solve the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 648, 920, 666]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 151, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 512, 92]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that the cubic equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[413, 98, 584, 119]]<|/det|>
\[x^{3} - 2x^{2} + 5x - 3 = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 126, 537, 145]]<|/det|>
has a root that lies between \(x = 0.7\) and \(x = 0.8\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 127, 920, 145]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 157, 153, 175]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 156, 609, 175]]<|/det|>
Show that this root also satisfies an equation of the form

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 183, 551, 217]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{a x^{2} + 3}{x^{2} + b},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 223, 510, 242]]<|/det|>
where the values of \(a\) and \(b\) are to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 224, 920, 242]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 254, 153, 272]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 254, 591, 272]]<|/det|>
With these values of \(a\) and \(b\), use the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 280, 559, 318]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \frac{a x_{n}^{2} + 3}{x_{n}^{2} + b}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 324, 920, 361]]<|/det|>
to determine the root correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 343, 920, 361]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 387, 96, 406]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 387, 437, 406]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[413, 413, 588, 432]]<|/det|>
\[x = \mathrm{e}^{3t},\quad y = t^{2}\mathrm{e}^{t} + 3.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 457, 154, 475]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 451, 358, 483]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{t(t + 2)}{3\mathrm{e}^{2t}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 459, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 495, 153, 514]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 495, 767, 514]]<|/det|>
Show that the tangent to the curve at the point (1, 3) is parallel to the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 495, 920, 514]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 526, 151, 545]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 526, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of the other point on the curve at which the tangent is parallel to the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 541, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[74, 587, 96, 606]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 587, 151, 606]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 587, 490, 606]]<|/det|>
By first expanding \(\cos (2x + x)\), show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 613, 603, 633]]<|/det|>
\[\cos 3x\equiv 4\cos^{3}x - 3\cos x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 613, 920, 632]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 651, 151, 670]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 651, 293, 670]]<|/det|>
Hence show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 673, 625, 712]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{6}\pi}(2\cos^{3}x - \cos x)\mathrm{d}x = \frac{5}{12}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 685, 920, 704]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
